t: “Come,*pn everyone who is thirsty, come*ln to the water; and*ln you without silver, come,*ln buy, and eat! Come,*ln buy wine and milk without*ln silver and without cost!
Why*ln do you spend silver on what is not food, and*ln your wages on what does not satisfy? Listen*ln carefully to me, and eat what is good, and*ln you will enjoy the choicest of foods.
Pay*ln attention and come to me; listen,*ln so that you will live. I*ln will make a permanent covenant with you on*ln the basis of the faithful kindnesses of David.
Since*ln I have made him a witness to the peoples, a*ln leader and commander for the peoples,
so*ln you will summon a nation you do not know, and*ln nations who do not know you will run to you. For*ln the Lord*s your God, even*ln the Holy One of Israel, has*ln glorified you.”
Seek*pn the Lord*s while he may be found; call*ln to him while he is near.
Let*ln the wicked one abandon his way and*ln the sinful one his thoughts; let*ln him return to the Lord,*s so*ln he may have compassion on him, and*ln to our God, for he will freely forgive.
“For*pn my thoughts are not your thoughts, and*ln your ways are not my ways.” This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“For*pn as heaven is higher than earth, so*ln my ways are higher than your ways, and*ln my thoughts than your thoughts.
For*ln just as rain and snow fall from heaven and*ln do not return there without*ln saturating the earth and*ln making it germinate and sprout, and*ln providing seed to sow and*ln food to eat,
so*ln my word that comes from my mouth will*ln not return to me empty, but*ln it will accomplish what I please and*ln will prosper in what I send it to do.”
You*pn will indeed go out with joy and*ln be peacefully guided; the*ln mountains and the hills will break into singing before you, and*ln all the trees of the field will clap their hands.

Instead*ln of the thornbush, a cypress will come up, and*ln instead of the brier, a myrtle will come up; this*ln will stand as a monument for the Lord,*s an*ln everlasting sign that will not be destroyed.
